us.phonetic: /v. dɪˈskɑrd; n. ˈdɪskɑrd/, (v. di skärd′; n. dis′kärd)

example.egtrans: 我们扔掉了一些旧衣服。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 抛弃, 丢弃, 扔掉

example.eg: The board considered Daisy's idea, but in the end they discarded it in favour of something else.
example.egtrans: 董事会进行了考虑，但最后还是放弃了黛西的意见，另选了其他。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 抛弃, 废弃, 放弃

us.phonetic: /v. dɪˈskɑrd; n. ˈdɪskɑrd/, (v. di skärd′; n. dis′kärd)

example.eg: Robert's discard was because he didn't have any decent cards.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 垫出的牌, 打出的无用的牌

example.eg: There were poor people at the rubbish tip, sifting through other people's discards.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 丢弃的东西, 废弃的东西

example.eg: I didn't have anything good to play, so I discarded.
I discarded a couple of low hearts from my hand.
